message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular seminoma tends to spread to the para-aortic lymph nodes via the testicular vein, hence option (A) is the correct answer.

We refer to the American Cancer Society article on testicular cancer for help. Seminoma is more likely to spread to the para-aortic lymph nodes located at the back of the abdomen near the spine. The other options are not typically involved in the spread of seminoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular seminomas are known to metastasize to para-aortic lymph nodes. Other options are not typically involved in metastasis from testicular seminomas.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular seminoma can spread through the lymphatic system and the para-aortic lymph nodes are the most likely to be involved due to their proximity to the testicles. The other lymph node groups listed are less likely to be involved in this type of cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular seminoma commonly metastasizes to the para-aortic lymph nodes, which are located along the aorta just below the level of the renal vessels. The other options are not typically involved in testicular seminoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular seminoma is known to metastasize to the para-aortic lymph nodes, which are located near the aorta and receive lymphatic drainage from the testes. The other options are not commonly involved in testicular cancer metastasis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Seminomas tend to spread via the lymphatic system and the most common site for metastasis is the para-aortic lymph nodes. Therefore, the para-aortic lymph nodes are most likely involved in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The para-aortic lymph nodes are the lymph nodes that drain the testes, making them the most likely group of lymph nodes to be involved in testicular seminoma. Superficial inguinal lymph nodes drain the scrotum and penis while the deep inguinal lymph nodes drain the lower limbs. The lateral group of superficial inguinal lymph nodes is not related to the testes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular seminoma is lymphatic spread to para-aortic lymph nodes. Superficial inguinal lymph nodes drain most of the penis and scrotum, but not the testis. The deep inguinal lymph nodes drain the thigh and the lateral group of superficial inguinal lymph nodes drain the lateral surface of the lower limb.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular cancer, specifically seminoma, tends to metastasize firstly to the para-aortic lymph nodes. The superficial inguinal lymph nodes are involved in metastasis if the tumor is in the scrotal area or involves the skin of the scrotum. The deep inguinal lymph nodes are involved if the tumor is in the lower leg, foot, and external genitalia.
